relation: configure terminal Example: Router# configure terminal
ip sla auto template type ip udp-jitter template-name Example: Router(config)# ip sla auto template type ip voip_g711alaw
codec codec-type [advantage-factor value][codec-numpackets number-of-packets][codec-interval milliseconds][codec-size number-of-bytes] Example: Router(config-tplt-udp-jtr)# codec g711alaw
description description Example: Router(config-tplt-udp-jtr)# description oper template for voip udp
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Begins configuring a template and enters IP SLA template configuration mode.
Sets the codec for the operation being configured.
(Optional) Adds descriptive text to the template being configured.
pageTitle: IP SLAs Configuration Guide, Cisco IOS Release 15M&T - Configuring Auto IP SLAs in IP SLAs Engine 3.0 [Cisco IOS 15.4M&T] - Cisco

textBeforeTable: DETAILED STEPS 4.    exit 3.    ip sla responder auto-register {source-ipaddress|source-hostname} [client-id client-id] [endpoint-list template-name] [retry-timer minutes] 2.    configure terminal 1.    enable SUMMARY STEPS Configuring Automatic Registration of Responder on the Destination Device Configuring an Auto-Measure Group on the Source Device Adding Proactive Threshold Monitoring to a Template on the Source Device Configuring a Template on the Source Device Configuring a Scheduler on the Source Device Configuring an Endpoint List on the Source Device Configuring Automatic Registration of Responder on the Destination Device How to Configure Auto IP SLAs in IP SLAs Engine 3.0 Destination Cisco devices and Cisco IOS IP SLAs Responders in Cisco devices can be configured to automatically register with the source. The source will discover the destination’s address and put it in an endpoint list. Automatic Registration of Destinations for Auto IP SLAs Operations
textAfterTable: SUMMARY STEPS 1.    enable 2.    configure terminal 3.    ip sla auto discovery 4.    ip sla auto endpoint-list type ip template-name 5.    description description 6.    discover [port port] 7.    access-list {standard-range | expanded-range} 8.    ageout seconds 9.    measurement-retry number-of-retries 10.    end 11.    show ip sla auto discovery DETAILED STEPS   Command or Action Purpose Step 1 enable Example:  Router> enable   Enables privileged EXEC mode.
